moves.1. d4 d5 2. c4 e6 3. Nf3 Nd7: Black's knight move is a bit oddball.  White to play.
moves.4. Nc3 Ngf6 5. Bf4 dxc4: Here Stockfish 8 gives 6. e3 a6 7. Bxc4 b5 8. Bb3 Bd6 9. Ne5 Bb7 10. O-O O-O 11. Rc1 with a slight advantage.
moves.6. e4: A little too aggressive.  Black will have a slight advantage after 6... Bb4 7. Bd2.  If instead 7. e5?! Nd5 8. Bd2 N7b6 and Black has no problems.
moves.6... Nb6: This will shift the advantage back to White.
moves.7. Bxc4: If 7... Nxc4 8. Qa4+ c6 9. Qxc4 with a slight advantage for White.
moves.7... Bd7: Puts an end to any tactical tricks.
moves.8. Bd3 Bb4: Unnecessarily moving a piece twice in the opening.
moves.9. O-O O-O 10. Rc1 Bc6 11. e5: Gaining space.  If 11... Bxf3 12. Qxf3 Nfd5 13. Qh3 g6 14. Bh6 Nxc3 (14... Re8 15. Ne4) 15. bxc3 Ba3 16. Rb1.
moves.12. Bxh7+: We have to keep in mind that the bishop on f4 is hanging.  If 12... Kxh7 13. Ng5+ Kg8 (13... Kg6 14. Qd3+ f5 15. exf6+ Kxf6 16. Be5+ Ke7 (16... Kxg5 17. Qh7) 17. Rfe1 Kd7 18. Nxe6) 14. Qh5 Re8 15. Qxf7+ Kh8 16. Qh5+ Kg8 17. Qh7+ Kf8 18. Qh8+ Ke7 19. Qxg7#.
moves.12... Kh8: Now White is fine after 13. Bd2 g6 14. Ng5 intending Bxg6.  14... Kg7 15. Bxg6 fxg6 (16. Nxe6+) 15... Kxg6 16. Qc2+ f5 17. exf6+ Kxf6 18. Qh7 Nxc3 19. Qh6+ Kf5 20. Qxe6#.
moves.13. Bb1: Drops a piece.  This is a huge blunder.
moves.13... Nxf4 14. h4: Prepares Ng5.  White could also play Qc2.
moves.15. Qxf3: Now Black can play 15... Bxc3 16. bxc3 Ng6 with a winning game.  If instead 15.... Qxd4?! 16. g3 and Black has a harder time defending his king.  16... Ng6 (16... Nfd5 17. Qh5+ and 18. Qh7#)  17. Qh5+ Kg8 18. Rfd1 Qxe5 19. Bxg6! and White gets  his piece back, but he is still down a pawn.
moves.16. g3: White has a fork, but he must be wary of checks.
moves.16... Nh3+ 17. Kg2: Now 17... Ng5 18. gxh4 Nxf3 19. Kxf3 just barely favors Black.
moves.18... Kg8 19. Ne2: To protect the rook on c1.  The Black knight on f3 isn't going anywhere.  If 19... g6 20. Rxh3 Qg7 21. Rxc7.
moves.22. Bg6: Black resigns.  If 22... f6 23. Qxf6+! gxf6 24. Rh8+ Ke7 25. R1h7#  Suppose play were to continue ...
moves.26. Qh5: Instead 26. Rh8+ takes a move longer.

gameName: October 2018 Open Main #1 Tournament, https://itsyourturn.com, http://gameknot.com/
